awd_titl_txt: Measuring and Modeling Control of Seated Posture
awd_abstract_narration: The objectives of this research are                                             to build a instrumented chair to                                                study seated posture stability and                                              to use the measurements obtained                                                from the chair to formulate and                                                 validate a model of seated posture                                              control.  This research is                                                      important since all previous                                                    studies have concentrated on the                                                control and modelling of standing                                               posture and gait.  In some                                                      situations, such as for children                                                with neuromuscular disorders, the                                               control of seated posture is very                                               important.  These studies could                                                 suggest strategies for surgical,                                                therapeutic and other interventions                                             to help stabilize patients in the                                               seated position.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems
